docs.snippet: Kik goes further than most widely used apps in shielding its users from view, often making it hard for law enforcement officials to know who is using it — or how....
docs.lead_paragraph: Kik goes further than most widely used apps in shielding its users from view, often making it hard for law enforcement officials to know who is using it — or how.
docs.abstract: Murder of 13-year-old Nicole Madison Lovell in Blacksburg, Va, has put spotlight on popular messaging app called Kik, which authorities say was used by two Virginia Tech students to communicate with victim; authorities say app has been linked to number of cases of sexual abuse against minors, and is particularly problematic because of way it shields identities of its users.

headline.main: Wildly Popular App Kik Offers Teenagers, and Predators, Anonymity
headline.print_headline: App Provides Anonymity to Teenagers, and to Predators, Too

docs.snippet: On death by Internet and the linguistic arms race to out-hyperbole each other with phrases like “Omg literally dying,” “I can’t even” and “yassssss.”...
docs.lead_paragraph: On death by Internet and the linguistic arms race to out-hyperbole each other with phrases like “Omg literally dying,” “I can’t even” and “yassssss.”
docs.abstract: Social media users tend to be overly dramatic when expressing emotion, bringing truncated hyperbole to English language that borders on the frequently absurd.
